does firestarter stop the firewall when: so iptables and the firestarter rules would still continue to run even if firestarter is not?
Yes.  All Firestarter does is load a bunch of packet filtering rules/policies into the kernel.  Unless you specifically have it remove them, they will stay intact.

No problem.  By the way, in case you are interested in a firewall alternative that is designed to automatically load at boot time, and is designed for Ubuntu, you can get it here: http://rob.pectol.com/content/view/27/1/
Let me know what you think.  It's been through several revs now and I believe it to be a good firewall solution for Ubuntu.
